required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial to Compare Efficacy and Tolerability of Fulvestrant 250mg, 250mg Plus 250mg Loading Regimen and 500mg
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Tolerability of Fulvestrant 250mg, 250mg Plus 250mg Loading Regimen and 500mg in Postmenopausal Women With ER +ve Advanced Breast Cancer Progressing or Relapsing After Previous Endocrine Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the relationship between fulvestrant dose and efficacy in postmenopausal women with oestrogen receptor positive advanced breast cancer.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: RECIST scans were performed every 12 weeks (+/- 2 weeks) from randomisation to until data cut off on 13th June 2008
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants who were objective responders over the number of participants evaluable for response x100. An objective responder = a patient whose best response is either CR (disappearance of all lesions) or PR (>= 30% shrinkage in the sum of the longest diameters of the measurable lesions + no new lesions + no progression of non-measurable lesions)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: RECIST tumour assessments carried out every 12 weeks (+/- 2 weeks) from randomisation until data cut off on 13th June 2008
secondary_outcome.description: Median time (in days) from randomisation until objective disease progression or death (in the absence of objective progression) using the Kaplan-Meier method

secondary_outcome.time_frame: RECIST tumour assessments were carried out every 12 weeks (+/- 2 weeks) from randomisation until data cut-off on 13th June 2008
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomisation until objective progression or death (in the absence of objective progression), measured only in those patients who achieved a confirmed Complete Response (CR) or confirmed Partial Response (PR)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Each patient was assessed for Clinical Benefit from the sequence of RECIST (Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours) scan data up to the data cut-off, 13th June 2008. RECIST scans were performed every 12 weeks (+/- 2 weeks) from randomisation.
secondary_outcome.description: A Clinical Benefit (CB) responder is defined as a patient having a best overall response of CR, PR or SD, provided that the SD was present at least 154 days from randomisation (ie. SD>=24 weeks - with the 2 week RECIST assessment time window allowed). The Clinical Benefit Rate is the percentage of patients with CB.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter: Mean Population Clearance, a Measure of the Efficiency With Which Fulvestrant is Eliminated From the Body
secondary_outcome.description: The measure of dispersion for mean population clearance is based on the estimated inter-individual variance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter: Mean Volume of Distribution at Steady State, a Measure of the Apparent Volume in the Body Into Which Fulvestrant Distributes
secondary_outcome.description: The measure of dispersion for volume of distribution is based on the inter-individual variance estimated for the apparent volume of plasma into which Fulvestrant distributes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Breast Cancer has continued to grow after having received treatment with an anti-estrogen hormonal treatment such as tamoxifen or an aromatase inhibitor.
- Requiring hormonal treatment.
- Postmenopausal women (woman who has stopped having menstrual periods)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with more than one previous regimen of systemic anticancer therapy other than endocrine therapy for advanced BC.
- Treatment with more than one previous regimen of endocrine therapy for advanced BC.
- An existing condition that prevents compliance.

overall_official.last_name: AstraZeneca Breast Cancer Established Brands Team Medical Science Director, MD

link.description: AstraZeneca Clinical Trial Information - Outside US

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Postmenopausal women with oestrogen receptor positive advanced breast cancer progressing or relapsing after previous endocrine therapy were randomised between 30th May 2006 and 29th November 2007

outcome.title: Objective Response (OR)
outcome.description: Number of participants who were objective responders over the number of participants evaluable for response x100. An objective responder = a patient whose best response is either CR (disappearance of all lesions) or PR (>= 30% shrinkage in the sum of the longest diameters of the measurable lesions + no new lesions + no progression of non-measurable lesions)
outcome.time_frame: RECIST scans were performed every 12 weeks (+/- 2 weeks) from randomisation to until data cut off on 13th June 2008

measure.title: Objective Response (OR)
measure.description: Number of participants who were objective responders over the number of participants evaluable for response x100. An objective responder = a patient whose best response is either CR (disappearance of all lesions) or PR (>= 30% shrinkage in the sum of the longest diameters of the measurable lesions + no new lesions + no progression of non-measurable lesions)

outcome.title: Time to Progression (TTP)
outcome.description: Median time (in days) from randomisation until objective disease progression or death (in the absence of objective progression) using the Kaplan-Meier method
outcome.time_frame: RECIST tumour assessments carried out every 12 weeks (+/- 2 weeks) from randomisation until data cut off on 13th June 2008

measure.title: Time to Progression (TTP)
measure.description: Median time (in days) from randomisation until objective disease progression or death (in the absence of objective progression) using the Kaplan-Meier method

outcome.title: Duration of Response (DoR)
outcome.description: Time from randomisation until objective progression or death (in the absence of objective progression), measured only in those patients who achieved a confirmed Complete Response (CR) or confirmed Partial Response (PR)
outcome.time_frame: RECIST tumour assessments were carried out every 12 weeks (+/- 2 weeks) from randomisation until data cut-off on 13th June 2008

outcome.title: Clinical Benefit Rate (CBR)
outcome.description: A Clinical Benefit (CB) responder is defined as a patient having a best overall response of CR, PR or SD, provided that the SD was present at least 154 days from randomisation (ie. SD>=24 weeks - with the 2 week RECIST assessment time window allowed). The Clinical Benefit Rate is the percentage of patients with CB.
outcome.time_frame: Each patient was assessed for Clinical Benefit from the sequence of RECIST (Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours) scan data up to the data cut-off, 13th June 2008. RECIST scans were performed every 12 weeks (+/- 2 weeks) from randomisation.

measure.title: Clinical Benefit Rate (CBR)
measure.description: A Clinical Benefit (CB) responder is defined as a patient having a best overall response of CR, PR or SD, provided that the SD was present at least 154 days from randomisation (ie. SD>=24 weeks - with the 2 week RECIST assessment time window allowed). The Clinical Benefit Rate is the percentage of patients with CB.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetic Parameter: Mean Population Clearance, a Measure of the Efficiency With Which Fulvestrant is Eliminated From the Body
outcome.description: The measure of dispersion for mean population clearance is based on the estimated inter-individual variance.
outcome.population: Participants who had PK samples only

measure.description: The measure of dispersion for volume of distribution is based on the inter-individual variance estimated for the apparent volume of plasma into which Fulvestrant distributes

reported_events.desc: 1 patient in the 250mg + LD arm was randomised but did not receive any randomised therapy. This patient is included in the efficacy summaries but is excluded from the safety summaries.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma Stage Unspecified

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
